description: A configuration file for the PrairieLearn server.
title: Backend Config

___externalGradingResultsS3Bucket.description: The S3 bucket where externally graded job results will be stored.

___postgresqlDatabase.description: The database for connecting to the PostgreSQL database.

___externalGradingS3Bucket.description: The S3 bucket that externally graded jobs should be stored in.

___secretKey.description: Secret key for authenticating users (should be a long random string).

___logFilename.description: Filename to use for server logging.

___serverType.description: The type of server to start.

___workersPerCpu.description: The number of workers per CPU (if workersCount is null).

___externalGradingJobRole.description: The ARN of the role that should be provided to external grading containers for resource access.

___postgresqlHost.description: The host for connecting to the PostgreSQL database.

___autoFinishAgeMins.description: Time after last activity when exams are auto-closed (minutes).

___checkAccessRulesExamUuid.description: On sync, check if assessment access rules examUuid exists in database (default false)

___authType.description: The type of authentication to use.

___externalGradingDefaultTimeout.description: The default timeout to use for external grading if none is specified by a question.

___externalGradingWebhookUrl.description: The endpoint that should be hit when a grading result is updated. Should be null when running locally.

___externalGradingUseAws.description: If the external grader should use AWS (production) or not (local dev).

___postgresqlUser.description: The user for connecting to the PostgreSQL database.

___groupName.description: The group of servers we belong to, used for load reporting and autoscaling.

___serverPort.description: The TCP port number for the server.

___redisUrl.description: The url for connecting to Redis.

___externalGradingJobQueue.description: The name of the job queue where externally graded jobs will be submitted.

___workersCount.description: The number of workers to use (or null to use workersPerCpu).
